title: Loops in Python

explanation.short: Python has for loops (iterate over sequences) and while loops (repeat while condition is true).
explanation.detailed: Python's for loop iterates over any iterable (lists, strings, ranges). The while loop repeats as long as a condition is true. Both support break (exit loop) and continue (skip to next iteration). Python also has list comprehensions for concise loops.

key_points: while loops repeat while condition is true
Use 'continue' to skip to next iteration
No traditional C-style for(i=0; i<10; i++)

loop_types.syntax:
for i in range(3):
    for j in range(3):

best_practices: Use for loops for known iterations
Use while loops for unknown iterations
Avoid modifying list while iterating over it
Use enumerate() to get index: for i, item in enumerate(list)
Use zip() to iterate multiple lists: for a, b in zip(list1, list2)
Prefer list comprehensions for simple transformations

common_mistakes.explanation: Always ensure while loop condition eventually becomes false

common_mistakes.right:
items = 
items = [item for item in items if item != 2]
common_mistakes.explanation: Modifying a list while iterating can skip elements or cause errors
